The difference in total cost per academic year between Ivy League schools has decreased in the last 10 years

All Ivy League institutions have experienced increases in their total costs exceeding the U.S. dollar inflation rate of 29.81 percent, with Columbia University having the lowest overall increase of 39.4 percent, and Princeton University having the highest increase of 48.52 percent.

Brown

Columbia

$85,000

In the upcoming academic year, annual costs vary between $79,090 to $85,200, a difference of $6,110.

Back in 2013, the annual cost varied from $53,250 to $61,116, representing a difference of $7,866 between Columbia and Princeton.

The gap between the total cost per academic year between Ivy League schools has decreased in the last ten years

However, Columbia still has the highest cost per term when compared to other Ivy League institutions with an estimated cost of $85,200 for the 2023-2024 academic year.
